parse.title: Troll general

Troll general
This article is about the trolls in the Troll Stronghold. For the trolls in Troll Invasion, see Troll general (Troll Invasion).
For the troll in Troll Warzone, see Morningstar.

Troll generals are huge and powerful giant trolls that live in Troll Stronghold, on the top floor.

Contents

  • 1 Locations
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Drops
    • 3.1 100%
    • 3.2 Charms
    • 3.3 Main drop
    • 3.4 Tertiary drops
    • 3.5 Rare drop table
    • 3.6 Universal drops
  • 4 Achievement
  • 5 Update history
  • 6 Trivia
  • 7 References
  • 8 See also

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
Troll Stronghold91None3Maplink

Strategy[edit | edit source]

Troll generals have a reasonably high drop rate of nature runes. This can be advantageous for players wishing to high alch the generals' salvage drops for profit. Utilising these methods, players can remain here for limitless hours collecting noted drops and high alching cheap weapons and armour for profit, however there are more profitable alternative methods of training. Furthermore, herbs can be noted with the Tool leprechaun on top of the stronghold, provided that My Arm's Big Adventure has been completed.

As a slayer task, Troll generals are a convenient, higher-level choice when assigned trolls. They have a reasonably high drop rate of nature runes and weapons and armour, including the occasional granite shield, and are a very easy 89.4 Slayer experience for medium-high level players.

It is possible to use magic attacks on the generals safely, as their large size allows them to be corner safe-spotted. Players with 50+ Magic and Defence should have no problem killing these quickly and safely, using only Regenerate or other healing abilities in place of food. With staff of fire for alchemy, and utilising the Tool leprechaun to note dropped herbs, such players could remain here indefinitely.

Achievement[edit | edit source]

  • Slayer of Chaos ( 0) – Obtained a collection of unique drops from Slayer monsters located within Keldagrim.
    • Granite shield drop

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 15 December 2014 (Update):
    • The troll general's combat level has been fixed.
  • update 24 August 2004 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Until February 2012, there used to be two level 113 generals and one level 171 general with identical combat statistics aside from their level. The two level 113 generals later had their combat levels increased to 130. After the Evolution of Combat, all three generals were given identical combat levels.
